Healthcare.description: A medium-sized medical facility or health centre.
A hospital providing in-patient medical treatment.
A shop where a pharmacist sells medications
A building erected for a hospital.
A non-clinical birthing centre operated by midwives.
A facility where you can donate blood, plasma and/or platelets.
A clinic for day patients to get a haemodialysis
A Hospice which provides palliative care to terminal ill people and support to their relatives.
Medical laboratory also called (analytical, diagnostic) is a place that analyses body fluids such as blood, urine, faeces etc.
A Midwife, a health professional who cares for mothers and newborns around childbirth.
Nursing. A facility where some nurses may receive their patients.
Site or dedicated healthcare facility where samples of blood/urine/etc are obtained or collected for purpose of analysing them for healthcare diagnostics.
a healthcare facility specifically dedicated to administering vaccinations to individuals, to provide immunisation against infectious diseases.

Emergency Services.description: A station of a fire brigade
A police station where police officers patrol from and that is a first point of contact for civilians
A building constructed as fire station, i.e. to house fire fighting equipment and officers, regardless of current use.
An ambulance station is a structure or other area set aside for storage of ambulance vehicles, medical equipment, personal protective equipment, and other medical supplies.
A designated (safe) place where people can gather or must report to during an emergency or a fire drill.

Shelter and Facilities.description: A small shelter against bad weather conditions.
Drinking water is a place where humans can obtain potable water for consumption.
Place where you can get large amounts of drinking water
A human settlement sheltering refugees or internally displaced persons

A generic tag for a building created to house some civic amenity, for example amenity=community_centre, amenity library, amenity toilets, leisure=sports_centre, leisure swimming_pool, amenity townhall etc.

Transportation.description: Roads which serve as an access to housing, without function of connecting settlements.
For access roads to, or within an industrial estate, camp site, business park, car park, alleys, etc.
For designated footpaths; i.e., mainly/exclusively for pedestrians.
The outline of a bridge, grouping together all features for that bridge.
A building related to public transport.
An artificial open flow waterway used to carry useful water for transportation, waterpower, or irrigation.
An artificial free flow waterway used for carrying superfluous water, usually lined with concrete.
A small artificial drainage waterway, usually unlined.
A barrier built across a river or stream to block and regulate the flow of the river.
A barrier built across a river to control water speed and depth.
Water area of the lock chamber.

Utilities.description: A medium or large disposal bin, typically for bagged up household or industrial waste.
A waste transfer station is a location that accepts, consolidates and transfers waste in bulk.
A wastewater plant is a facility used to treat wastewater.
Structure with a water tank at an altitude to increase pressure in water network
A structural facility to access ground water, created by digging or drilling.
A facility where water is treated to make it suitable for human consumption.
High-voltage power lines used for power transmission, usually supported by towers or pylons
Minor power lines forming the distribution grid, usually carried by poles.
An industrial facility where power (electricity, useful heat, biogas) is produced by individual power generator units.
A facility which controls the flow of electricity in a power network with transformers, switchgear or compensators.
A place to connect landlines subscribers to telecommunication service equipments
Last point of telecom local loops allowing direct connections towards a few households and subscribers
Equipment, often small boxes, allowing to directly connect up to 15 individuals or households to a single upstream local loop cable towards telecom exchanges
Active equipment which deliver service to connected customers.
A building used to house computers and network equipment.
